intro: Goniophlebium menisciifolium, commonly known as the menisciifoliate fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically green and have a feathery appearance. The plant produces sporangia on the underside of its leaves, which are clustered in sori, a common feature in ferns. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest undergrowth or on rocky surfaces. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare member of the fern family.
